resources.string: Check out SuperBAD, and Android programming demo app made by Ruiz. http://helloruiz.com/projects/superbad/
The cover art for the music.
The photo taken using the camera.

Super Basic Android Demo
Version 1.01

Created by Ruiz Akpan
http://helloruiz.com
ruiz.akpan@gmail.com

A simple Android demo created over the simple desire of wanting to simply learn about Android programming.

Based on lessons taught from the Android Developers website.

Created Dec 2012 - Jan 2013.

This is a \"Hello World!\" style demo that simply takes in a text input value from the user, and passes it along to another activity.\n\nCompared to other demos, this demo is excruciatingly basic and was done within the first hour of learning to program in Android.
Info about this demo is already contained within it. Play around!

This demo will create, write to, read from, and delete data within a directory called 'SuperBAD' in the 'Download' folder of your SD card.

You must have an SD card (internal or external) installed for this demo.

If data is unable to be manipulated for whatever reason, the demo will let you know.

This demo gives a few options for interacting with other apps.\n\nIt\'s best to have a phone, email, browser, and map app installed so that you can try out all of the functions. If there\'s no app available for the function you\'re trying to perform, the demo will let you know.

This demo will play a small audio track. This demo does not respond to media control inputs such as the ones from keyboards, headsets, or bluetooth devices.\n\nWhile the function of the demo is simple, coding it was a bit trickier when compared to other demos.

This demo will take a photo or video using the camera and display it back to you.

A working camera app is needed to use this demo. You must also have an SD card (internal or external) installed.

Photos are saved in a directory called 'SuperBAD' in the 'Pictures' folder of your SD card. Videos are saved in their default location.

If your image appears rotated, it's an issue with certain manufacturer cameras, namely Samsung. The result shouldn't be rotated when viewing the photo within the 'Gallery' app.
